title: No Access Control
vulnerability_information:
There is "No Access Control" vulnerability identified in "lob-assets.com" on Invoice section.

## Steps To Reproduce:
Go to "https://lob-assets.com/statements/stmt_1c4021f90737ea0.pdf?version=v1&expires=1557572375&signature=cnOl7M6XzdBZMWljqZe69e82eQfMs25NqVHJhz8fG7UEQ-ZLI0lv5MXx-lCtySkXTS_iMuPMwLS3KpQGpv86DQ"

Anyone who is not authenticated on the site can view the Invoice of any user by just accessing the link.

## Supporting Material/References:
Kindly refer to the attachment

## Impact

It causes severe impact as anyone can view invoice of any user along with several information(Such as Account id)

activities.message:
The issue identified is "No access control" on view invoice . By just accessing URL, we get invoice without need of authentication. We can get the URL by MITM, saved in Cache on public system & viewed by any user and several different attacks as every parameter is passing in URL(GET request). There are several examples of "no access control" on invoice view. And anytime after logout or multiple logins no value (Even signatures or any parameter) never changes in URL. You can view invoice anytime by just accessing these urls.

Examples:-

https://lob-assets.com/statements/stmt_8b62a1904cc967c.pdf?version=v1&expires=1557581354&signature=SePJzZXmghlGmiHMSweewFh1pwEIkMvO_tB3Zi1KbL2ylSwZFVaini4EHYkLf6K34rCKyp_lJfQrF_vkZPGwAA

https://lob-assets.com/statements/stmt_a10ab3e32961976.pdf?version=v1&expires=1557581799&signature=BH9Ina8RqalTO3Q7T7qBNgEjwoWaixCXEeEnnpWg-VTlbSYXaz_Ctrt6NoqlBl92QKwIkSLUPz0HGnz7LbMTCg

activities.message:
Hi @common 

As the links you have provided hold no sensitive information as it stands, we do not see this as a security risk. There is no extra information provided on these invoices which suggest these are simply templates. Just an outlook of what the templates could look like. An account number is present but that does not link to anybody or any company as that information is blank on the invoices.  There is no direct impact shown here for what an attacker can do to utilize these invoices.

If you find a way to actually use these invoices to an attacker's advantage, we'd be more than happy to review this report. However, we currently do not see any security risk here within the invoices as no sensitive information is shown as well as no charges.

Thank you,
@orangeband

activities.message:
Hi @common,

Based on your initial description, there do not appear to be any security implications as a direct result of this behavior. The statements are protected by a hard-to-guess filename (`stmt_8b62a1904cc967c.pdf`) and long `signature` parameter. Man-in-the-Middle is not possible due to HTTPS.

Your effort is nonetheless appreciated and we wish that you'll continue to research and submit any future security issues you find. If you disagree, please reply with additional information describing your reasoning.

Kind regards,
@beagle
